title: Obari
author: Obari
content: I don't always do this often but I thought it wise to say some words of encouragement to the newbies as I really do understand how much effort it takes to grow on the forum and I want to use this medium to advice all newbies to keep pushing and not restrain from making meaningful contributions to the community because you aren't getting the expected appreciations for your works and efforts which I understand is most times disheartening but I want to encourage you to continue the good works as most times merits and rewards might not come at the expected time and might even take weeks or even months before your work gets recognized, hence what I'm saying in essence is that if you don't make quality post(preparation) then merits (success) wouldn't come, so keep making good post and I assure that the desired rewards will come in.These are just some kind words of advice and encouragement from me to those who need it.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on September 21, 2023, 02:17:15 PMI don't always do this often but I thought it wise to say some words of encouragement to the newbies as I really do understand how much effort it takes to grow on the forum and I want to use this medium to advice all newbies to keep pushing and not restrain from making meaningful contributions to the community because you aren't getting the expected appreciations for your works and efforts which I understand is most times disheartening but I want to encourage you to continue the good works as most times merits and rewards might not come at the expected time and might even take weeks or even months before your work gets recognized, hence what I'm saying in essence is that if you don't make quality post(preparation) then merits (success) wouldn't come, so keep making good post and I assure that the desired rewards will come in.These are just some kind words of advice and encouragement from me to those who need it.Your words will work for the newbies (mean it will definitely encourage them to not give up) but I would also like to add my version, which is, that newbies have different mindsets, which means, they have different purposes here, some want to learn, some want to earn, some want to get trust (trust of other, not positive trust) but of course some might be looking to get some positive trust too, Just because these aforementioned things looks good on their profile. Besides all that, I have seen many newbies even legendaries have made a good topic or reply but for some reason, they don't get that much appreciation. For such cases, there are many merits sources who have opened threads, to mention such topics or replies so that those merit sources would give them some appreciation. To be honest, I don't think newbies will value the importance of merits at the start but as time passes those who don't will understand it. Pro tip, don't post to get merits or trust. Post to get a reputation, be legit and dedicated to the forum, and of course try to contribute and grow faster. Join your local board, because I have seen many newbies don't even know that they have their own local board, Like I came to knew about my local board after a long period.

comments.author: Cyber_Alien
comments.body: This sounds like something that would definitely inspire beginners, in my opinion. Actually, it's not easy at all, but the more you participate in the forum, comprehend its guidelines, and post worthwhile discussions, the more merit you'll get. In order to avoid discouraging newcomers, I would want to encourage people with high rank and merit sources to always offer merit for quality posts.This difficulty is one I initially encounter. I had trouble coming up with good topics to write, but the longer I stay on the site, the more I begin to get the idea of Bitcoin. So, right now, contributing to the forum is quite simple. I urge newcomers to thoroughly research a certain subject and to express their opinions on it. Do not post or comment outside of the themes.

comments.author: Hewlet
comments.body: I think as a newbie, trying to figure out how the forum work so as not to get banned was my initial challenge and sometimes you make a post that you think is of high quality and it's not recognized that much.I still draw strength from your post and will take my time to make quality posts and engage on other posts are see how the growth process will look like

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Participation in a forum like this shouldn't solely revolve around the pursuit of merits and ranking up. If someone's primary motivation is to accumulate these then, they may be missing the essence of the community. Instead, it's more meaningful to be authentic and view this platform as a valuable opportunity for personal growth and learning. Engaging in discussions about cryptocurrency, money, blockchain, and related topics allows individuals to expand their knowledge and expertise over time.When you genuinely contribute to the community by sharing insights, asking thoughtful questions, and engaging in meaningful discussions, your efforts are likely to be recognized by fellow members. Merits and other forms of recognition will naturally follow as a byproduct of your authentic engagement. This approach benefits not only the individual but also contributes to the overall improvement of the Bitcoitalk community as well.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on September 21, 2023, 02:17:15 PMThese are just some kind words of advice and encouragement from me to those who need it.Staying here on this forum is by choice and not by force, there are thousands if not millions making registration each day amd are not staying but only few stay because they realized the need why they should, as usual i expect every newbies to encounter one or two difficulties while staying and this shouldn't be an obstacle to their stay, all should rather be considered as part of the requirements on learning process and later will turn to their experience, nobody should feels intimidated here just by mere discussion when they are not what you receive in physical, if you really want to stay then you must learn and never feels intimidated during all the period of your stay.

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: Your word of motivation is highly appreciated and I believe newbies will be grateful to you when ever they come across this thread but one thing we must not forget is this, not getting enough merit doesn't mean the community isn't seeing your good works and not having merit doesn't mean someone is not growing, so many people are here for different reasons some are here to acquire knowledge of cryptocurrency only while some people are here to have more knowledge and to render some services too so I think everyone is for a particular reason.Not forgetting that merit is one of the things that takes some one to another rank but we shouldn't forget that the said merit is one of the easiest things to get here because it is freely given and it is freely received all you need to do is to put in your knowledge to writing but taking out time to read and get informations that will be helpful to the community and the people in it. When ever we motivate newbies, I think we should also encourage them to work and not be relaxed hoping that good information and knowledge comes easily, I hope they get motivated after reading this.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: My encouragement to the newbies here is to read harder the tech behind bitcoin and basics of bitcoin. The forum recognise members with deep knowledge in bitcoin. The higher the knowledge of bitcoin a member harness the stronger the love. If a newbie reads and studies bitcoin to understand new features and developments being added to bitcoin, they'll love to discuss more about bitcoin and stay active in the forum. Newbies who create posts with few knowledge on bitcoin, their thread will only be attended to like any other random posts in the forum. But if they create posts out of strong and rich information about bitcoin such that other members can, through the thread, refresh their memories or learn new info about the growth of bitcoin. The newbie will feel a certain amount of fulfilment for learning bitcoin and the merit, which OP tagged as success can come subsequently to such newbie for learning bitcoin. The merit can facilitate the newbies to take action and read further to increase their knowledge of bitcoin.  A lot of newbies leave the forum because their posts don't seem important and no merits awarded to them, they'll quit the forum. That's why I encourage newbies to read extensively on bitcoin, they will see a better result in their personal response to bitcoin and also make new friends here in the forum.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: Good advice OP, I guess your advice has touched the mind of newbies to prepare themselves well by reading and study anything that contain cryptocurrency so that they will be able to meet this opportunity in the community that will put smile in their mouth base on their quality Post. I know that newbies will not remain for newbies forever which you know, and they are trying their possible best to meet this opportunity but is not easy for them to meet the opportunity because they are still lacking one or two things, but they will continue doing what is good until they reach that success you are talking about.  I guess this advice is for me because since I decided to be more active in Bitcointalk forum by reducing some of the activities that is keeping me busy  day and night not to learn from Hiro members and legendary members has add more impact to me, and the way I use to respond to some Post in the Bitcointalk forum and local board have made me to believe that some day I will share my newbies story like the way full members and serior members are always sharing their journey history in the community.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: A good gesture from your side as motivation plays a significant role in bearing hardships, also would like to mention, that these days I'm encountering most of your topics  , seems like you really like starting a discussion on different topics.Anyway, besides that my new colleagues, I'd like to share a quick word of advice, consistency is the key to growth, you may find it challenging in the early stages but it will undoubtedly bring out some substantial output, so keep trying. Don't run for merits, prefer gaining some domain knowledge and gaining a reputation in the community merits will naturally follow as your contributions gain recognition..For the rest Best of Luck.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Forum members have been very loving and caring to most newbies and if you check recent merit earnings among members in all levels of the forum ranks you still discover that newbies have accumulated a lot of merits and that shows the positive position of the other forum ranks in motivating newbies most especially those who make meaningful contributions.Havent been one of such newbies who enjoyed this benevolence from other higher ranks members in the past, I stand to say that, the only newbies that find it most difficult to grow in the forum are those who are not actively active 8n the forum and haven't made any meaningful contributions to discussions.So for that, I found your advice most helpful at this point to show newbies that there is a reward for quality continuity in the forum.

comments.author: Asuspawer09
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on September 21, 2023, 02:17:15 PMI don't always do this often but I thought it wise to say some words of encouragement to the newbies as I really do understand how much effort it takes to grow on the forum and I want to use this medium to advice all newbies to keep pushing and not restrain from making meaningful contributions to the community because you aren't getting the expected appreciations for your works and efforts which I understand is most times disheartening but I want to encourage you to continue the good works as most times merits and rewards might not come at the expected time and might even take weeks or even months before your work gets recognized, hence what I'm saying in essence is that if you don't make quality post(preparation) then merits (success) wouldn't come, so keep making good post and I assure that the desired rewards will come in.These are just some kind words of advice and encouragement from me to those who need it.I mean it wasn't really necessary of required to make a great quality post, you could pretty much post everything you want here in the forum, But for sure this forum is great if you really want to learn about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency there was no doubt about it since this is where I learn most of my knowledge about cryptocurrency. The best thing to do here is to start your journey on cryptocurrency, probably you could start investing already if you think you already know what you are doing you have done enough research already, and you want to start investing to make a profit. This forum could help you if you are just a beginner posting here could make you learn a lot and at the same time you could ask anything here if you having a problem or just want some advice about cryptocurrency or how you going to invest.The more you gain experience here in the cryptocurrency space the more you can create more quality posts here in the forum and that just means you're probably going to get more merits, I mean there are some benefits if you gain a good rank here in the forum at the same time you're also investing, I think that's a good opportunity already for every newbie to start there investment journey at the same time start here in the forum since its already a great community.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: I've seen several responses and wow I must co fess that people really have different different opinions about an issue or a topic and this always makes me believe  that understanding truly matters in life.To all those who think it is normal for people to bother about growing on the forum, you're right and also to people who think people shouldn't be bothered about growing in ranks on the forum doesn't really matters as what truly matters is the fact that you're making meaningful posts and merits and growth doesn't matter. But from my opinion,  the truth be told that no matter your aim and purpose on the forum, there is always a joy that comes with ranking up and these ranking only comes from receiving merits and merits o ly come from making good post and my opinion is that people shouldn't feel discouraged if they aren't getting merits especially  when they feel they've made good post because some times people read and appreciate  your post but might be short in merits to appreciate your post and might have you in mind till they have some smerit to appreciate your work which might take weeks or even days or months.

comments.author: Lorokan
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on September 21, 2023, 02:17:15 PM These are just some kind words of advice and encouragement from me to those who need it.In addition, i will say don't stop learning, don't stop contributing your knowledge to the forum; everywhere in the world, no one knows it all. An important advantage of the forum is the opportunity to learn massively either in economics, bitcoin, trading, mining or politics. By focusing on learning, contributing and interacting in the forum; you will achieve more than you can imagine.Focus on the bigger goal; dream big. and Remember the more you learn, the better for you in the long run.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: I think the reason why most newbies give up their account easily is that they expect every post they make to get merits, and when that doesn’t happen, they feel unappreciated and develop the mindset that high rank members only give merits to themselves. I remember when you were a newbie, today you on your way to hero member. This is enough motivation for newbies to take themselves seriously and build their account. Bitcointalk isn’t as hard as you let yourself believe.
